@description.name: @description
@description.body:
*****************************************************************

qooxdoo - the new era of web development http://qooxdoo.org Copyright: 2004-2008 1&1 Internet AG, Germany, http://www.1und1.de License: MIT: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT See the LICENSE file in the project's top-level directory for details. Authors: Martin Wittemann (martinwittemann) *

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
A date field is like a combo box with the date as popup. As button to open the calendar a calendar icon is shown at the right to the textfield. To be conform with all form widgets, the {@link qx.ui.form.IForm} interface is implemented. The following example creates a date field and sets the current date as selected. 

 var dateField = new qx.ui.form.DateField();
 this.getRoot().add(dateField, {top: 20, left: 20});
 dateField.setValue(new Date());

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: popup {qx.ui.popup.Popup} popup which shows the list control
@childControl.description: popup which shows the list control

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: textfield {qx.ui.form.TextField} text field for manual date entry
@childControl.description: text field for manual date entry

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: button {qx.ui.form.Button} button that opens the list control
@childControl.description: button that opens the list control

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whenever the value is changed this event is fired Event data: The new text value of the field.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The formatter, which converts the selected date to a string. *

@description.name: @description
@description.body: String value which will be shown as a hint if the field is all of: unset, unfocused and enabled. Set to null to not show a placeholder text.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the shared default date formatter

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the default date format which is returned by {@link #getDefaultDateFormatter}. You can override this method to define your own default format.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks for "qx.dynlocale" and adds a listener to the locale changes. On every change, {@link #_setDefaultDateFormat} is called to reinitialize the format. You can easily override that method to prevent that behavior.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method sets the date, which will be formatted according to #dateFormat to the date field. It will also select the date in the calendar popup.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {Date} The date to set.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the current set date, parsed from the input-field corresponding to the {@link #dateFormat}. If the given text could not be parsed, null will be returned.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the DateField. The textfield will be empty and the datechooser will also have no selection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Shows the date chooser popup.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Hides the date chooser popup.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Toggles the date chooser popup visibility.

@description.body: property apply routine

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handler method which handles the key press. It forwards all key event to the opened date chooser except the escape key event. Escape closes the popup. If the list is cloned, all key events will not be processed further.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.KeySequence} Keypress event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a new child widget. The supported keys of the layout options map depend on the layout manager used to position the widget. The options are documented in the class documentation of each layout manager {@link qx.ui.layout}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the item to add.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the item to remove

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove all children.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array} An array containing the removed children.
@return.description: An array containing the removed children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the index position of the given item if it is a child item. Otherwise it returns -1. This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the item to query for

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The index position or -1 when the given item is no child of this layout.
@return.description: The index position or -1 when the given item is no child of this layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add a child at the specified index This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} item to add

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index, at which the item will be inserted
@param.description: Index, at which the item will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description

Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.description: item, after which the new item will be inserted

@param.name: @param

@description.name: @description

Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.description: Index of the item to remove.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #dateFormat}.
